data.title: 7 highest-rated and supremely entertaining films of Rajkummar Rao to watch before Srikanth; available on Prime Video, Netflix, JioCinema, ZEE5 and more
meta_keywords: Rajkummar Rao films on prime video
data.meta_description: From Shahid to Newton, check out Rajkummar Rao's highly rated movies available on Amazon Prime Video, Netflix, JioCinema and more
data.text:
National Award-winning actor Rajkummar Rao has delivered a series of remarkable performances and carved a niche for himself in the Hindi film industry. The 39-year-old actor is set to return to cinemas soon with a biographical drama, titled Srikanth. The film is based on the life of Srikanth Bolla, a visually impaired entrepreneur and the founder of Bollant Industries which provides employment to differently-abled individuals. In this article, we’ve compiled a list of Rajkummar Rao’s highly-rated and entertaining films that deserve a spot on your watchlist.

7 highest-rated and supremely entertaining films of Rajkummar Rao to watch before Srikanth; available on Prime Video, Netflix, JioCinema, ZEE5 and more

1. Shahid – Amazon Prime Video

IMDb rating: 8.2

In 2012, Rajkummar Rao collaborated with filmmaker Hansal Mehta on a hard-hitting biographical film titled Shahid. The film traces the story of Shahid Azmi, a former militant operative who became a lawyer and human rights activist and was falsely convicted of terrorism and assassinated. Rao’s stellar performance in the gritty film helped him earn his first National Award. The critically acclaimed film also featured Mohammed Zeeshan Ayyub, Prabhleen Sandhu and Baljinder Kaur in supporting roles.

2. Aligarh – Amazon Prime Video, JioCinema, ZEE5

IMDb rating: 7.8

This Rajkummar Rao and Manoj Bajpayee starrer tells the story of Dr Shrinivas Ramchandra Siras, an esteemed professional who taught Marathi at the Aligarh Muslim University. He was sacked from his role when a sting operation exposed his sexual orientation. Rao essays the role of Journalist Deepu Sebastian, who helps the professor deal with the complicated situation.

3. Kai Po Che – Netflix, Amazon Prime Video, YouTube, Apple TV+

IMDb rating: 7.8

After winning the National Award for his performance in Shahid, Rajkummar Rao teamed up with Amit Sadh and late actor Sushant Singh Rajput for filmmaker Abhishek Kapoor’s sports drama, titled Kai Po Che. An adaptation of Chetan Bhagat’s 2008 novel The 3 Mistakes of My Life, the film tells the tale of three close friends who stand by each other through thick and thin. However, the earthquake of 2002, followed by communal riots, changed their lives forever.

4. Newton – Amazon Prime Video

IMDb rating: 7.6

Directed and co-written by Amit V. Masurkar, this black comedy flick features Rajkummar Rao in the lead role. He essays the role of Nutan Kumar, an honest government servant who is willing to go to any extent to hold a fair election in a politically sensitive area. Does he achieve his goal? Newton was selected as India’s official entry to the 90th Academy Awards. The film also features Pankaj Tripathi, Anjali Patil and Raghubir Yadav in prominent roles.

5. Ludo – Netflix

IMDb rating: 7.6

Written and directed by Anurag Basu, Ludo is an engaging and entertaining film that revolves around four parallel stories that intertwine in a game of fate. Apart from Rajkummar Rao, the film also features Abhishek Bachchan, Aditya Roy Kapur, Pankaj Tripathi, and Fatima Sana Shaikh, among others. A brilliantly written film with unexpected plot twists, complex characters, and noteworthy performances.

6. Trapped – ZEE5

IMDb rating: 7.5

This psychological thriller revolves around a call centre employee named Shaurya, who accidentally locks himself in his newly rented house, located on a higher floor in a newly constructed residential tower in Mumbai. With no food, water, or electricity available in the house, Shaurya ends up resorting to extreme measures to survive in this Vikramaditya Motwane directorial.

7. Stree – JioCinema

IMDb rating: 7.5
